data.title: UE5 Mini Dark Souls game demo
data.description:
UE5 Third-Person Combat Demo ‚Äì Modular Combat & Animation Prototype

A third-person melee prototype built in Unreal Engine 5, featuring modular weapons, precise hit detection, stamina/poise systems, directional knockback with hit-stun, resettable light/heavy combo chains, 8-way rolls/backstep/guard, enemy lock-on with target switching, and an animation stack that combines Motion Matching with layered blends for smooth, natural transitions and reduced ‚Äòmechanical‚Äô feel.

Player Controller & Core Systems
‚Ä¢ Movement, camera rotation, jumping, attacking, executions, lock-on/unlock with target switching, stamina consumption/recovery, blocking & mitigation, health.

Combat Mechanics
‚Ä¢ Resettable light/heavy combo chains; running/sprint/jump attacks; hit detection via line/sphere traces with damage + hit-stun + 4-direction knockback; multi-hit dedupe and debug visualization.

Defense & Resources
‚Ä¢ Block timing and success check; stamina timers and thresholds; poise thresholds triggering staggers/knockdowns.

Mobility
‚Ä¢ 8-way rolls and backstep; direction selection from velocity/acceleration; adaptive camera boom for readability.

Animation Quality
‚Ä¢ Explored and integrated Motion Matching, blending with Layered Blend per Bone / Slots‚Äîupper-body attacks while lower-body stays on MM locomotion; IK retargeting for cross-skeleton reuse.

Enemy AI (Behavior Tree)
‚Ä¢ Blackboard + services for distance checks and state gating; patrol (random location / reach) ‚Üí engage ‚Üí approach ‚Üí attack ‚Üí react ‚Üí die; coordinated with the player lock-on system.

Architecture & Tuning
‚Ä¢ Enhanced Input mappings; data assets for weapons/segments/values; tunables for trace radius/length, lock-on selection (angle/distance/LOS), and camera offsets.

data.title: Quad Game demo
data.description:
QuadGame ‚Äì HTML5 Canvas Mini Quadcopter:

Game Loop & Frame Pipeline
‚Ä¢ Initialized canvas; built the requestAnimationFrame loop loop(timestamp) with stable dt. Each frame: spawn enemies ‚Üí handle input & move the player ‚Üí update enemies/missiles ‚Üí resolve collisions ‚Üí render grid, base marker, crafts, missiles, and HUD.

Modular Rendering
‚Ä¢ Craft Type 1 (Mavic-like): drawMavicBody()/drawQuad() with diagonal arms, motor pods, and optional nose;
‚Ä¢ Craft Type 2 (Ducted-fan): drawDuctedQuad() with four ring ducts, central fuselage, and large-span props.

Controls & Lightweight Physics
‚Ä¢ Movement: WASD strafe/forward, Q/E rotate; thrust along forward/right vectors with damping; M/N toggle motors (stop instantly zeroes velocity).
‚Ä¢ Weapons: spacebar fires missiles at a timed cadence; missiles have lifetime and out-of-bounds culling.

Enemies & Pathing
‚Ä¢ A polyline route defined by pathPts; spawnEnemy() periodically creates HP-bearing enemies; moveEnemies() advances them via segmentwise linear interpolation and prunes when the path ends.

data.title: Game Animation Sample battle demo
data.description:
UE5 Third-Person Combat Demo ‚Äì Modular Combat & Animation Prototype:
A third-person melee prototype built in Unreal Engine 5, featuring modular weapons, precise hit detection, stamina/poise systems, directional knockback with hit-stun, resettable light/heavy combo chains, 8-way rolls/backstep/guard, enemy lock-on with target switching, and an animation stack that combines Motion Matching with layered blends for smooth, natural transitions and reduced ‚Äòmechanical‚Äô feel.

Weapons & Hit Detection
‚Ä¢ Modular BaseWeapon setup: socket-driven line/sphere traces for hits; applies damage + hit-stun + 4-direction knockback; montage-timed hitboxes.
‚Ä¢ Implemented ignore self/ignore list, multi-hit dedupe per swing, and debug visualization.

Combat Loop
‚Ä¢ 8-way rolls, backstep, guard with stamina/poise interaction; resettable light/heavy combos plus running/sprint/jump attacks.
‚Ä¢ Lock-on / unlock and target switching (left/right or mouse wheel), with camera and movement vectors aligned to the locked target.
‚Ä¢ Stamina/Poise costs and thresholds that gate actions and trigger stagger/knockdown states.

Animation System
‚Ä¢ Integrated Motion Matching and combined it with Layered Blend per Bone / Animation Slots: upper-body attack montages while the lower body stays on MM-driven locomotion.
‚Ä¢ IK Retargeting for cross-skeleton reuse; direction-aware roll montage selection based on velocity/acceleration.

Data & Architecture
‚Ä¢ Data-driven weapon/attack segments (damage, poise, timing); Enhanced Input mappings.
‚Ä¢ Tunables for trace radius/length, collision channels, lock-on selection (angle/distance/LOS), and camera offsets.

Logistics Simulation Game ‚Äì Prototype (9√ó9 Grid, Resource-Delivery Board Game):
A native HTML/CSS/JS strategy prototype. Three players start from their üè† warehouses, roll a D6, and move orthogonally on a 9√ó9 board. At ‚õèÔ∏è resource tiles, they draw R/B/G items (1‚Äì3, bag cap = 3) or exchange two of the same color ‚Üí 1√óüü†. Deliver color combos to üè™ Store 1 / üè¨ Store 2 to finish randomized tasks and score points. The first finisher scores; other contributors must pay a 1-item shipping fee on their next visit, and previously contributed items are returned to their warehouse at the start of their next turn. First to 12 points wins. The build features a dark, glassy UI, turn pulse and movement trails, iOS-style modals, HUD panels, and in-page test logging.

Board & Map Generation:
‚Ä¢ Procedurally builds the 9√ó9 grid; randomly places üè† warehouses per player, 4 resource nodes (incl. the üü† exchange), and 2 stores, with centered emoji markers.

Turn & Movement Rules:
‚Ä¢ Implements turn order and D6 roll; enforces orthogonal adjacency; current tile pulses, and traveled cells get a fading trail.

Resources & Inventory:
‚Ä¢ Bottom-sheet modal at resource tiles; choosing to pick ends the turn and rolls for 1‚Äì3 items; bag cap = 3 with an interactive drop/keep chooser; supports the 2√ósame-color ‚Üí üü† exchange.

Tasks & Scoring:
‚Ä¢ Per-store randomized tasks (color tallies + points); auto-donation from the bag, with contributor tracking; finisher scores, others get feeDue and returnsPending (shipping + item returns next turn start); then the store spawns a new task. 

Players & Visualization:

data.title: Fireworks Simulation
data.description:
Fireworks ‚Äì HTML5 Canvas Animation (Interactive + Physics-lite):
A minimal Canvas 2D fireworks demo. Click anywhere to spawn a firework; the system also auto-spawns one every 1.5s at a random target. Each firework follows a gravity-affected arc and explodes near its target into colorful particles that fade out over time.

Projectile Kinematics
‚Ä¢ Initial velocity computed toward the target (gravity ay=0.15)
‚Ä¢ Detonates when within 5px of target or after 80 frames

Particle System
‚Ä¢ Explosion spawns ~30 particles (random angle & speed)
‚Ä¢ Gravity ay=0.05, life = 100 frames
‚Ä¢ globalAlpha = life/100 for linear fade-out

Color & Interactivity
‚Ä¢ randomColor() produces vivid RGB palette
‚Ä¢ Click to spawn custom bursts
‚Ä¢ Auto-spawn every 1.5s in upper canvas region
